availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Jessamine County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Polly Wade Waters on July 4, 1846. Father of Perry Waters, Louisa Waters, and William P. Waters. Farmer in Jessamine County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Jessamine County in 1860. Served in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry as a private from December 23, 1861 to September 6, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, 1st Division, p. 27A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, Nicholasville, p. 53.
"Bluford Waters (1827-1892)," Find A Grave, Memorial 85073608 , accessed January 30, 2024, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/85073608 .
Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954, Genealogical Society of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT, Jessamine County Marriages, Film 007724997.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 144, 468.
